p: 1. The theme of the book. The question of method. The thematic object here is the being of things or the intelligibility of being in general. ◊ With that, the method seems to be already prescribed—ontology seeks to make the being of things stand out and [then] to explain being itself—but the methods governing traditional ontologies are highly questionable. We are using “ontology” here in a formally broad sense and will not try to clarify its method by merely tracing out its history. ◊
